articles.title: Apple's Tim Cook On His Biggest Dispute With Steve Jobs: 'His Way Was More Creative And More Different'
articles.content:
In 2011, Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL) co-founder Steve Jobs announced his resignation as the company's CEO, just six weeks before his death. As an obvious successor, Tim Cook then took over as the company's new CEO.  
During a recent media event, Cook recounted his journey at the company and spoke highly of Jobs. 
When asked about his biggest debate with Jobs, Cook said it regarded Apple's iPhone sales strategy ahead of its 2007 launch.
At the time, Cook suggested opting for the subsidy route in collaboration with AT&T. He proposed that the phone carrier ...

articles.title: 2 Stocks to Invest in Virtual Reality
articles.content: Microsoft and Apple are making their own bets on an emerging virtual world.
